it.bori.jbfw.core.webrepo

Class RemoteWebRepository

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.bori.jbfw.core.webrepo.RemoteWebRepository
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class RemoteWebRepository
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Remote Web Repository Connector class that allow user to interact ( only view and navigate ) inside a remote Java Content Repository an URL it's normally builded like "http://localhost:4502/crx/server/crx.default"
    Author:
    Andrea Bori
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.lang.String host
      Remote Machine Host Name by default it's "localhost"
      private java.lang.String navPath
      Navigation path, by default it's "/" it's can't go more backward than "/"
      private int port
      Remote Machine communicating port by default it's "4502"
      private static long serialVersionUID
      serialVersionUID used for serialization
      private boolean ssl
      Condition if it's used secured connection with HTTPS or simply HTTP
      private java.net.URL url
      URL object composed by protocol+host+port+workspace
      private java.lang.String workspace
      Remote Machine Workspace by default it's "crx/server/crx.default"

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      RemoteWebRepository(java.lang.String host, int port, java.lang.String workspace, java.lang.String user, java.lang.String pass)
      Less specific constructor, connect to a remove Java Content Repository, if username and/or password are empty or null it will throw a RemoteWebRepositoryAuthenticationException
      RemoteWebRepository(java.lang.String host, int port, java.lang.String workspace, java.lang.String user, java.lang.String pass, boolean ssl)
      Default constructor, connect to a remove Java Content Repository, if username and/or password are empty or null it will throw a RemoteWebRepositoryAuthenticationException
      RemoteWebRepository(java.lang.String host, java.lang.String workspace, java.lang.String user, java.lang.String pass)
      Basic constructor, connect to a remove Java Content Repository, if username and/or password are empty or null it will throw a RemoteWebRepositoryAuthenticationException

    • Constructor Detail

      • RemoteWebRepository

        public RemoteWebRepository(java.lang.String host,
                           int port,
                           java.lang.String workspace,
                           java.lang.String user,
                           java.lang.String pass,
                           boolean ssl)
                    throws RemoteWebRepositoryAuthenticationException
        Default constructor, connect to a remove Java Content Repository, if username and/or password are empty or null it will throw a RemoteWebRepositoryAuthenticationException
        Parameters:
        host - name of machine containing Java Content Repository, by default it's "localhost"
        port - port where service it's connected, by default it's "4502"
        workspace - name of the workspace by default it's crx/server/crx.default
        user - user name used to authenticate with the remote machine
        pass - password used to authenticate with the remote machine
        ssl - boolean if it's used the SSL "HTTPS" to authenticate
        Throws:
        RemoteWebRepositoryAuthenticationException - called when user name and/or password are not valid

      • RemoteWebRepository

        public RemoteWebRepository(java.lang.String host,
                           int port,
                           java.lang.String workspace,
                           java.lang.String user,
                           java.lang.String pass)
                    throws RemoteWebRepositoryAuthenticationException
        Less specific constructor, connect to a remove Java Content Repository, if username and/or password are empty or null it will throw a RemoteWebRepositoryAuthenticationException
        Parameters:
        host - name of machine containing Java Content Repository, by default it's "localhost"
        port - port where service it's connected, by default it's "4502"
        workspace - name of the workspace by default it's crx/server/crx.default
        user - user name used to authenticate with the remote machine
        pass - password used to authenticate with the remote machine
        Throws:
        RemoteWebRepositoryAuthenticationException - called when user name and/or password are not valid

      • RemoteWebRepository

        public RemoteWebRepository(java.lang.String host,
                           java.lang.String workspace,
                           java.lang.String user,
                           java.lang.String pass)
                    throws RemoteWebRepositoryAuthenticationException
        Basic constructor, connect to a remove Java Content Repository, if username and/or password are empty or null it will throw a RemoteWebRepositoryAuthenticationException
        Parameters:
        host - name of machine containing Java Content Repository, by default it's "localhost"
        workspace - name of the workspace by default it's crx/server/crx.default
        user - user name used to authenticate with the remote machine
        pass - password used to authenticate with the remote machine
        Throws:
        RemoteWebRepositoryAuthenticationException - called when user name and/or password are not valid

      • setPort

        private void setPort(int port)
        Set the connection port, not allowed less than 49152 and no more than 65535
        Parameters:
        port - the port number, must be between 49152 and 65535 by default it's 4502

      • setAuthenticator

        private void setAuthenticator(java.lang.String usr,
                              java.lang.String pwd)
                       throws RemoteWebRepositoryAuthenticationException
        Call only internally, define the default Authentication for HTTP protocol, when opening the "url" inside a browser it will prompt a message containing "requiring user name and password" this will reply automatically, if password or username are not setted or empty RemoteWebRepositoryAuthenticationException will be triggered
        Parameters:
        usr - User name of repository
        pwd - Password of repository
        Throws:
        RemoteWebRepositoryAuthenticationException - called when user name and/or password are not valid

      • getList

        public java.lang.String[] getList()
                           throws RemoteWebRepositoryParsingException
        Get all node inside the specific path
        Returns:
        String[] array with a list of subLink, can be empty
        Throws:
        RemoteWebRepositoryParsingException - called when any error occurred while parsing and fetching content from a given path

      • fetchFile

        public boolean fetchFile()
        Read and download a file to a local instance
        Returns:
        boolean true if success else false

      • buildLocalPath

        public boolean buildLocalPath(java.lang.String path)
        Build inside a local instance a folder structure based on given path
        Parameters:
        path - path containing the folder structure
        Returns:
        boolean condition if success

      • getContent

        public java.lang.String getContent()
                            throws RemoteWebRepositoryParsingException
        Read the file content and return a string with the file content
        Returns:
        String containing the file source
        Throws:
        RemoteWebRepositoryParsingException - called when any error occurred while parsing and fetching content from a given path

      • isFile

        public boolean isFile(java.lang.String path)
        Check from a given path, if that redirect to a source file ( if has an extension then it's a file )
        Parameters:
        path - the path where check this condition
        Returns:
        boolean true if it's a file else false

        public int getDeepLevel()
        Return the current deep level
        Returns:
